bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Earl I. Brown, March 12, 1915

div1.p: [Carter] requests permission to make a sanitary survey of an area around the Coosa River.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Earl I. Brown, March 12, 1915
div1.opener:
March 12, 1915.
Major Earl I. Brown,
U. S. Engineer Corps,
Bell Building,
Montgomery, Ala.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I am informed by Mr. O. G. Thurlow of the Alabama Power Co.
that a dam on the Coosa River at Lock No. 18 will shortly be in-
stalled. That it is contemplated that the water so impounded will
be used conjointly for the improvement of navigation and the opera-
tion of a hydro-electric power plant.

I have been engaged in making sanitary surveys of large
bodies of impounded water in malarial sections of the South and
am especially desirous of making the following surveys: (1) A
sanitary survey of the area which will be covered by the water and
its immediate environment before the water is turned in. (2)
Similar surveys of the same area and environment for the first
three years after the pond is filled. (3) A survey for about the
eighth year of the pond. There is no difficulty whatever in get-
ting ponds for the 2nd. and 3rd. kinds of survey, but only one
suitable for the 1st. kind has been offered me, and that in a less
eligible place than the one on the Coosa River would be.

I would ask, then, that if the above quoted statements of Mr. Thur-
low are correct, would it be agreeable to yourself for me to make a
sanitary survey of the area which will be covered by water in the
pond contemplated at Lock 18, Coosa River, which work I understand
is under your supervision? If the work is under a contractor and it
is agreeable to you for me to make this survey I will be glad if you will
put me in communication with him as I would probably wish to make
arrangements for the board and lodging of myself and associate at
his camp and probably get water transportation from him.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Senior Surgeon,
U. S. Public Health Service. HRC/LC
